answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have found a variety of programs on the Knowledge Network that deal with diversity and multicultural outreach.
Phoenix, AZ has created an outreach program in an effort to address tensions in the community caused by the growing diversity of their population.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4371/Were_All_On_The_Same_Team_Cultural_Diversity_Program
You can see a similar program below from Boulder, CO.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301053/Value_Based_Service_Delivery_Creating_a_culture_of_service_through_Inclusion_and_Diversity
I have also included an ICMA article called, Serving Diverse Communities - Cultural Competency. It includes case studies and discusses some of those best outreach practices.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/document/6452
The City of Chandler, AZ created a Diversity Office a couple of years ago. You may want to contact them for more information. 
http://icma.org/en/Article/10072/City_of_Chandler_Announces_New_Diversity_Office
Also, in a different method of outreach I have included a story from Janesville, WI where they have been teaching the importance of diversity and multiculturalism through school playgrounds.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5263/Playground_Teaches_Cultural_Diversity
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Douglas Matthews
text:
Hi folks. I'm looking for cities/counties that have some form of cultural diversity or multicultural outreach office or program in place. We're exploring some options here in Austin and are looking for some "best practice" examples we could draw from. Thanks in advance...
Doug.
title: Cultural Diversity Office?
